title: The 2025 U.S. News college rankings are out. Here’s how Mass. schools fared.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Education Of the best liberal arts colleges in the nation, Massachusetts took first and second place.
The Great Dome on the MIT campus in Cambridge.

title: A Massachusetts city was named among the best places to live on the East Coast
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Tell Us “In terms of real estate, there is something for everyone.
" Good Harbor Beach in Gloucester, Mass.
Erin Clark/Globe Staff Travel + Leisure released a list of the 10 best places to live on the East Coast, and a Massachusetts town — along with several New England seaside towns — earned recognition.

title: What Boston meteorologists are saying about Thursday’s heavy rain
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Weather "Locally heavy rainfall is possible which could result in minor urban and poor drainage street flooding.
" Jessica Rinaldi / The Boston Globe, File ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Local meteorologists say heavier rain is on tap for Thursday after a wet Wednesday.

title: Violet Affleck, daughter of Ben Affleck and Jennifer Garner, makes impassioned speech at U.N. about long COVID
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Celebs Violet Affleck, 19, a student at Yale, spoke to the U.
N.
on Tuesday about the need for global indoor air standards to combat long COVID and other post-viral conditions.

title: More police to patrol Somerville Community Path as teens allegedly harass residents
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Several locals have taken to social media to describe unnerving encounters with young people assaulting or harassing people on the Somerville Community Path.
Somerville Community Path in 2023.
Lane Turner/The Boston Globe By Molly Farrar September 24, 2025 | 2:51 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Large mural stolen off the side of a Cambridge arcade
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Crime Two people cut down the artwork from the side of DX Arcade in Central Square in broad daylight, the owner of the business said.
A mural outside DX Arcade in Central Square before it was stolen.
Sean Hope/Courtesy A large mural was stolen in broad daylight from the side of an arcade in Central Square recently, prompting a police investigation.

title: ‘That’s the plan’: Mike Vrabel discussed Christian Gonzalez’s possible Patriots return in Week 4
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots "Hopefully he'll be ready to go.
" Christian Gonzalez on the Patriots' sideline during the season-opener against the Raiders.

AP Photo/Charles Krupa By Hayden Bird September 24, 2025 | 1:52 PM 1 minute to read The wait to see Christian Gonzalez make his 2025 Patriots season debut could be coming to an end against the Panthers on Sunday.

title: Would you support gene editing in wild animals to prevent disease?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Tell Us Scientists in Nantucket are trying to release genetically engineered mice in order to prevent Lyme disease.
Scientists in Nantucket are modifying mice DNA on the island to prevent the spread of Lyme disease.
CDC via AP, File Scientists in Nantucket are modifying mice DNA on the island to prevent the spread of Lyme disease.

title: Tom Brady dismissed ‘paranoid and distrustful’ accusations over Raiders conflict of interest
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "With all the success it has given me, I feel I have a moral and ethical duty to the sport; which is why the point where my roles in it intersect is not actually a point of conflict, despite what the paranoid and distrustful might believe.
" Tom Brady and Kevin Burkhardt prior to calling the Bears-Cowboys game on Sept.
21 for Fox Sports.

title: ‘A very disturbed mind’: Fairhaven man sentenced for assaulting girls with wife, including his daughter
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Crime Shayne Medeiros raped his daughter and other underage victims, sometimes with his wife present and participating, prosecutors said.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A Fairhaven man was sentenced to 26 years in prison Monday after pleading guilty to a slew of charges including child rape.
